org.openadaptor.legacy.convertor.dataobjects
Class DataObjectToDOXmlConvertor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.convertor.AbstractConvertor
          org.openadaptor.legacy.convertor.dataobjects.AbstractLegacyConvertor
              org.openadaptor.legacy.convertor.dataobjects.AbstractDataObjectConvertor
                  org.openadaptor.legacy.convertor.dataobjects.DataObjectToDOXmlConvertor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
public class DataObjectToDOXmlConvertor
extends AbstractDataObjectConvertor

Convert Data Objects into DOXML (using legacy openadaptor functionality).
Note: Usage of this class depends on the availability of a legacy openadaptor jar to do the conversions, as openadaptor 3 doesn't directly support dataobjects, or DOXML.

Author:
Eddy Higgins

Method Detail

setAttributes

public void setAttributes(java.util.Map attributeMap)
Assign attributes for the legacy convertor compenent.
Consult legacy openadaptor documentation for details on possible attributes.
Note: this defaults the attribute USE_UNIQUE_ID_ATTR to true which is in keeping with legacy adaptor behaviour. By default the XMLFormatter does not issue a uniqueid. Unfortunately, the legacy sink that it's associated with sets it to true, so pretty much all actual usage does have it set. It's forced here, unless a configured Map explicitly overrides it.

Overrides:
setAttributes in class AbstractLegacyConvertor
Parameters:
attributeMap -

convert

protected java.lang.Object convert(org.openadaptor.dataobjects.DataObject[] dobs)
                            throws RecordException
This converts a supplied DataObject[] into a DOXML String
Note: Usage of this method depends on the availability of a legacy openadaptor jar to do the conversions, as openadaptor 3 doesn't directly support dataobjects, or DOXML.

Specified by:
convert in class AbstractDataObjectConvertor
Parameters:
dobs - contains an Array of DataObjects
Returns:
XMl representation of the data
Throws:
RecordException - if conversion fails
